channel.title: [PI] Tokens arn't saving?

item.title: [PI] Tokens arn't saving?
item.dc:creator: @jSherz jSherz
item.description:
@jSherz wrote:

When you are saving your tokens, you have to include the spaces and equal sign in the length of the string to write. For example:

The characters of prestige, two spaces and an equals gives you: 11

Same with prestigeTokens:

prestigeTokens + space + equals + space = 17

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Tokens arn't saving?
item.dc:creator: @13lack_drag 13lack drag
item.description:
@13lack_drag wrote:

I recently created a prestige system, and i got the ints, and the tokens, and all that, but the token’s arent saving. once you logout, and log back in, they are 0 again.

Here are the tokens:

} else if (token.equals("prestige")) { p.prestige = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("prestigeTokens")) { p.prestigeTokens = Integer.parseInt(token2);

And

characterfile.write("prestige = ", 0, 7); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.prestige), 0, Integer.toString(p.prestige).length()); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("prestigeTokens = ", 0, 13); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.prestigeTokens), 0, Integer.toString(p.prestigeTokens).length()); characterfile.newLine();

Oh ,and i don’t know if this matters, but they show up in the char file like this.\

bossTokens = 227
prestige0 <–
prestigeToken0 <–

Read full topic
